runs.comm: And Shahzad's first ball in international cricket is smashed back over his head. Under pressure straight away
full, on off stump and that's a much better delivery

gone! Shahzad picks up a wicket with his third ball in international cricket! Nazir runs down the wicket and has aims a hoick over midwicket, but the top edge flies down to Bresnan at third man, who takes an easy catch
good ball, Farhat gets forward and plays the ball watchfully into the covers

another wicket! Two in three balls for Shahzad! Back of a length, another silly stroke as Farhat attempts to pull the ball over midwicket, but he doesn't get near to timing it, giving Stuart Broad an easy catch at mid on
good, sharp ball, 138kph, back of a length but Malik gets behind it and defends off the back foot
starts with one down the leg side, sounded like it may have clipped the pad but given wide
much better ball, on off stump and defended
slightly shorter and on the hips, tucked to leg and they run through for two
played watchfully again by Umar, he's got to stay at the crease and he knows it
short and pulled, but not timed and Shahzad fields the ball at fine leg and they scamper through
good ball again, and defended. Malik and Akmal look calm at the wicket, they need to consolidate here
great shot, pitched up slightly and the batsman stands tall and punches that square, and the ball races to the boundary
short, Akmal was waiting for that length and he pulls it through midwicket. He didn't look to have timed it all that well, but the ball makes it to the boundary
short again and intelligently played by Akmal, he plays the ball intentionally off the face of the bat through the vacant slip area down to third man
similar shot, but to the fielder this time
slower ball, and pitched up. Malik picks it though, and taps it calmly to the off side
another short one, 136kph, Malik is slightly squared up by this and it thuds into his thigh pad. No harm done though

outside off, Malik swings at it but the ball keeps low on the way to Prior, who misses it and the ball rolls away for byes. Not the best display of keeping there, tough though as the ball bounced just infront of him
and he starts with a good ball, on off stump and there's some seam movement on it, played defensively
Akmal gets his front leg out of the way and has a go, times it well but straight into the covers. Good shot for no runs
shortish, 139kph, but played with ease down to third man
on a length outside off, the ball doesn't look to be coming on to the bat here, and its played into the covers
fuller, but met with a solid defensive push, no runs though
slightly straighter, Malik clips this to leg
too straight from Bresnan, tucked to leg and the batsmen run a very quick two. Good running
this one seams back in, cramping Malik for room and rushing on to him a bit. He tried to play it down to third man but the ball took the inside edge
straight again and seaming in, pushed defensively to leg
extraordinary shot! Malik backs away to give himself some room, Bresnan digs the ball in but Malik clubs it over wide long on
moves across to leg this time, turning the ball to the leg side
short again, played down to third man and very well stopped by Luke Wright at third man. He saved a boundary there.
good line on off stump, defended square on the off side
nudged towards mid on who is on the edge of the circle which allows an easy single
ooh, tries to be inventive here as he steps across his crease and tries to scoop his over the keep but misses and is nearly bowled
that's a much better shot, guided through backward point and third man can't prevent the second despite a good throw
pushed into the off side but can't find the gap as backward point swoops on the ball
well bowled, that was sharp from Broad as he banged in a short ball that Akmal in a tangle it crashed into his gloves but fell safely to ground

well, well, has he struck first ball? It's a wide that spins down the leg side and there's a sharp piece of work from Prior to whip off the bails. Did Malik's foot lift? It's a tough one to give, the batsman may get the benefit...but no, he's been given! The foot was marginally in the air, and it was a brave call by Kumar Dharmasena the third umpire
spins towards leg, takes the pad towards short fine-leg
outside off, nicely driven square through the off side and it's placed well for a couple
good line on middle and off, comes forward and defends to the leg side
quicker ball outside off, well bowled, and Akmal is beaten as he tries to guide it to third man
outside off, leans into a cover drive
appeal from Swann as this one turns sharply into Afridi but it's done too much and he gets a leg bye
just a hint of width outside and Afridi places it perfectly through backward point with a strong back-foot square drive...the crowd love it, they go fairly bonkers when he does anything
uses the pace and angles down to third man, the fielder is square so there's time to come back for a second
inside edge onto the thigh pad, loops into the leg side
full outside off, driven through the covers and the sweeper cleans up (no pun intended, honest)
good bouncer, Afridi was actually early on his shot and was through it by the time the ball arrived
another good short one to end the over, almost a wide but it was well-directed over leg stump
more spin, takes a thick inside edge into the leg side as he drives
driven onto the off side
dropped that's a chance, a quicker ball which Akmal edged as he tried to cut but Prior couldn't gather it
lovely flight, defended with bat and pad together
tossed up outside off, drilled firmly but straight at cover...five dot balls, brilliant stuff from Swann
completes a maiden as this one comes off the pad to short fine-leg
starts with a short ball, pulled away over midwicket and long on scampers around to field
that's a real heave-ho from Akmal, no shape to the shot, and he misses it my a miles as he moves outside leg stump
tucked neatly off leg stump, placed nicely wide of deep square-leg and that's far more sensible batting than wild slogs
a carving, slashing edge flies down to third man...no chance for the fielder but that was too wide from Wright and Akmal could free his arms
better from Wright, pitched up on off stump and defended into the covers
slower ball down the leg side, why wasn't that called a wide? Well, that's a surprise. Wright gets away with one
down the pitch and hit powerfully down to long off

got him! Afridi comes down the track and heaves this to leg, looked to have got hold of it but it was straight down Morgan's throat at wide long on. The crowd have been stunned into silence, and that's a major blow for Pakistan
big turn on that one, Akmal backs away and it turned sharply in to him, manages to get something on it though and they scamper through
cautious start from Alam
well-timed push through the covers, and strong running gets the batsmen two
starts with a very slow offcutter, played off the face to short third man and they sprint through
another slow offcutter, but he's started too far outside leg and Alam works the ball to long leg with ease
that one was practically just an offspinner. Collingwood bowling very slowly here
goes for the slog sweep, but not timed very well and easily fielded at midwicket
Alam moves right across his stumps and tries to paddle this, glances off his gloves and down to fine leg. He was lucky to get something on that , as it was heading for the stumps
heaved down to long off, who collects it on the bounce, and they can only manage a single
pitched up and flighted, Alam plays the ball through the covers out to the sweeper
pitched up again, and the batsmen grab another run
fired in at offstump, Alam gives himself room but the ball finds the bottom edge and they scamper through
comes down the wicket and heaves mightily at this one, the ball trickles to Prior but Akmal is back in the crease in time
Umar goes! Swann picks up a wicket with his final ball. Akmal tried to loft this one over midwicket, he timed it reasonably well, but not well enough and Morgan hardly has to move
pitching on leg, Alam tries to flick it away but can't connect
he moves right across his stumps and tries to paddle this, gets a top edge over Prior's head and they run through
and Razzaq has a massive swipe at his first ball, really gave it everything but didn't get near the ball
and again, he get's hold of it this one. Denly was interested on the midwicket boundary for a while, but the ball just kept on going and landed a good three metres over the rope
another massive hit! He's had another huge mow and this one flies into the crowd. Huge hit
very full ball on offstump, and he times it well but straight to long off.
Razzaq backs away but Wright follows him, the ball seams in as well but he gets some bat on it down to a wide fine leg
a short offcutter and it's clubbed straight back at Wright, who could n't get a hand on it
Alam times a full, wide ball very well into the covers, but straight at the fielder
six more! full, straight, and he just gave himself some room and lifted it cleanly straight back over Wright's head. Razzaq's looking very good here
backs away, Wright follows him with a slower offcutter but Razzaq heaves to leg this time, and good running gets him two
another offcutter, slightly short and Razzaq clubs it down to long-off, didn't quite time that one, but importantly he keeps the strike
gives himself room outside leg and angles it away to third man
slower-ball bouncer, a familiar tactic, and it's pulled away towards fine leg off the top edge
swung from off side down the ground and long on makes an excellent save on the boundary
short again and pulled away through square leg, the man in the deep gets around and keeps them to a couple...Pakistan playing it well
driven square through the off side, placed nicely and it's another two which keeps Pakistan up with the rate
backs away, gives himself room and gets a thick edge past Shahzad at short third man...great boundary for Pakistan
heaved through midwicket and goes one bounce to deep midwicket, gee he middled that
on off stump, swung hard into the leg side straight to Pietersen at midwicket...there's no run and Pietersen's shy is miles off target
cracking shot, that's a ripper, drilled straight down the ground and it was past Bresnan before he knew anything about it
makes room to carve through the off side, cut hard but straight to deep cover
dragged down by Bresnan, Razzaq connects well but picks out long on
charges down the pitch, gets a meaty top edge which loops into space and falls short of long on who charges in...he manages to keep them down to a single. Good over from Bresnan
gone! Big wicket from Broad as the short ball works again. Fawad made good contact, but he picked out deep square-leg who barely had to move
leg stump yorker which Razzaq can only clip out to deep midwicket
bouncer first up, Arafat ducks and it's a priceless dot ball...good thinking from Broad
well, Arafat was about to duck another bouncer but at the very last minute flinched and ramped it down to third man...the ball was almost past him
cut hard down to third man
leg stump yorker, but it's placed perfectly down the ground and it allows them to come back for a second
low full toss outside off, gives himself room and takes the bottom of bat down to third man
goes full at the stumps, drilled down towards long on and they are able to scamper back for a second again
that could be the game...Shahzad gambled with a slower legspinner and Razzaq picked it, swung hard through the line and cleared long off by miles
what's happened there?! It looked like a great catch from Denly at long off, but the ball bounce just in front of him
that's stupid from Trott, a full toss was carved away and there was no run but for some reason he threw at the stumps and missed by miles to give away an overthrow

and that is that, what a way to win it...a wonderfully clean strike over long on seals the victory. A breathless innings from Razzaq and Pakistan, after so many defeats recently, can finally taste victory.
